choices.text:
write a python function to filter out the empty strings in a list of strings.
Here is one way you can do that.  It uses Python’s built-in “filter” method, which takes an iterable and returns only those elements for whom some condition given as a function argument evaluates true (or 1). In this case we use filter to take the list of strings provided by our caller code; then inside it apply another call that checks if each string is empty or not.  If so return None, otherwise just pass on what was returned from before:
def remove_empty(strings): 
    return [s for s in strings if len(str) > 0]
